text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hussein says challenges facing comprehensive Middle East peace must be faced.
- Government says no exceptions to be made in its decision to remove illegal housing on state property.
- Central Bank's foreign reserves reach around $1 billion.
- Jordan and Egypt to start discussions on a free trade zone at the start of 1998.
- Jordanian-Kuwait contacts to arrange high level talks which would be preceded by reopening of the Jordanian embassy in Kuwait.
- King stresses backing peace camps, lifting siege on Iraq.
- Spain blocks Jordan-EU accord over size of tomata paste quota.
